org.logevents.observers

Class FileLogEventObserver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.logevents.observers.FileLogEventObserver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LogEventObserver
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DateRollingLogEventObserver

    public class FileLogEventObserver
extends java.lang.Object
implements LogEventObserver
    Logs events to file. By default, FileLogEventObserver will log to the file logs/your-app-name-%date.log as determined by defaultFilename(org.logevents.config.Configuration). By default, each log event is logged with time, thread, level and logger.

    Example configuration:

     observer.file.filename=logs/my-file-name-%date.log
 observer.file.formatter=PatternLogEventFormatter
 observer.file.formatter.pattern=%date %coloredLevel: %msg
 observer.file.formatter.exceptionFormatter=CauseFirstExceptionFormatter
 observer.file.formatter.exceptionFormatter.packageFilter=sun.www,uninterestingPackage

    File name pattern

    The following conversion words are supported in the filename:
    • %date: The date and time of the log event. Optionally supports a date formatting pattern from DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern(java.lang.String) e.g. %date{DD-MMM HH:mm:ss}. Default format is yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS.
    • %marker[{defaultValue}]: Marker (if any)
    • %mdc{key:-default}: the specified MDC variable or default value if not set
    • %application: The value of Configuration.getApplicationName()
    • %node: The value of Configuration.getNodeName() ()}
    See Also:
    PatternLogEventFormatter

      • createFormatter

      • defaultFilename

        public static java.lang.String defaultFilename(Configuration configuration)
        Determines default log file name. If the main class of the application was loaded from a jar-file, the name of the jar-file, without version number, will be used. If the main class of the application was loaded from a directory, the current working directory base name will be used.
